intro: Spergularia nematopoda, commonly known as the sand spurry, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is a low-growing annual plant characterized by its prostrate or ascending stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically thrives in sandy or coastal environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh, saline conditions. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Spergularia nematopoda plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and is often found in dune ecosystems.
